Package Project

Class Order

java.lang.Object
Project.Order
public class Order
extends java.lang.Object
This class holds all the functionality and information for the orders.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Order.Type
    The order types available.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Order()
    Empty order constructor for the GUI.
    Order​(int orderId, int userID, int assetID, Order.Type type, int quantity, int price)
    Order Constructor with ID.
    Order​(int userID, int assetID, Order.Type type, int quantity, int price)
    Order Constructor without ID, database creates the ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Empty order constructor for the GUI.

    • Order

      public Order​(int userID, int assetID, Order.Type type, int quantity, int price)
      Order Constructor without ID, database creates the ID.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the asset involved in the order.
      assetID - The ID of the asset involved in the order.
      type - The type of order it is (BUY or SELL).
      quantity - The quantity to create of the order.
      price - The price of the order.

    • Order

      public Order​(int orderId, int userID, int assetID, Order.Type type, int quantity, int price)
      Order Constructor with ID.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The ID of the order.
      userID - The ID of the asset involved in the order.
      assetID - The ID of the asset involved in the order.
      type - The type of order it is (BUY or SELL).
      quantity - The quantity to create of the order.
      price - The price of the order.

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public void addOrder​(Order myOrder)
      Adds a created order to the database.
      Parameters:
      myOrder - The order to add.

    • removeOrder

      public static void removeOrder​(int orderID)
      Removes an order from the database. If the order status is completed it cannot be removed.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The order orderID.

    • updatePrice

      public void updatePrice​(int orderID, double newPrice)
      Updates the price of a sell order in the database.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the sell order to update.
      newPrice - The new price.

    • updateStatus

      public static void updateStatus​(int orderID, int newStatusID)
      Updates the status of an order in the database.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the sell order to update.
      newStatusID - The new status.

    • compareOrders

      public static void compareOrders​(int buyOrderID, int sellOrderID)
      Compares two orders and adds a transaction to the database if requirements are met.
      Parameters:
      buyOrderID - The ID of the first order.
      sellOrderID - The ID of the second order.

    • getOrder

      public static Order getOrder​(int orderID)
      Searches for an order in the database using the order ID and retrieves it.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to find.
      Returns:
      The order if it exists, otherwise returns null.

    • getOrderType

      public static Order.Type getOrderType​(int orderID)
      Searches for an order in the database using the order ID and returns its type.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to find.
      Returns:
      The type of the order, otherwise returns null.

    • getOrderStatus

      public static java.lang.Integer getOrderStatus​(int orderID)
      Searches for an order in the database using the order ID and returns its status ID.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The ID of the order to find.
      Returns:
      The status ID of the order, otherwise returns null.

    • getAssetOrders

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAssetOrders​(int assetID) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Retrieves list of all the current orders out on an asset in the database.
      Parameters:
      assetID - The ID of the asset to get orders for.
      Returns:
      The list of all the IDs of order out on an asset.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getUserOrders

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getUserOrders​(int userID) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Retrieves list of all the current orders a user has in the database.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user to get orders for.
      Returns:
      The list of all the IDs of order made by a user.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getPrice

      public static java.lang.Double getPrice​(int orderID)
      Retrieves the price of a current order.
      Parameters:
      orderID - The order to get price for.
      Returns:
      The price of the order, or null if something went wrong.

    • getAllOrders

      public javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel getAllOrders() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates table model for orders in the GUI - lists all current orders.
      Returns:
      A DefaultTableModel if the orders could be found.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • updateOrder

      public static void updateOrder​(int userID, int assetID, int type, int qty, double price, int orderId) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates order information in the GUI.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of user who owns the order.
      assetID - The ID of the asset the order is on.
      type - The type of order.
      qty - The quantity of the asset.
      price - The price of the order.
      orderId - The ID of tne order updating.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getAllUserOrders

      public javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel getAllUserOrders​(int userID) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates table model for a specific users orders - lists all orders of a user.
      Parameters:
      userID - The ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A DefaultTableModel if the orders could be found.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getAllOrgOrders

      public javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel getAllOrgOrders​(java.lang.String orgName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates table model for an organisation's orders - lists all orders of an organisation.
      Parameters:
      orgName - The name of the organisation.
      Returns:
      A DefaultTableModel if the orders could be found.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getAllDashOrders

      public javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel getAllDashOrders() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates table model for current orders for all users to see - lists all orders, but only specific information.
      Returns:
      A DefaultTableModel if the orders could be found.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getOrgOrderHistory

      public javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel getOrgOrderHistory​(java.lang.String orgName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates table model for complete orders (order history) for all users to see in a specific organisation.
      Parameters:
      orgName - The name of the organisation.
      Returns:
      A DefaultTableModel if the orders could be found.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • checkOrderStatusAsset

      public static java.lang.Boolean checkOrderStatusAsset​(int assetID) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks all orders of an asset if any are completed.
      Parameters:
      assetID - The asset to check orders on.
      Returns:
      True if there are completed orders, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • checkOrderStatusUser

      public static java.lang.Boolean checkOrderStatusUser​(int userID) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Checks all orders of a user if any are completed.
      Parameters:
      userID - The user to check orders on.
      Returns:
      True if there are completed orders, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • lowestPrice

      public static double lowestPrice​(double buyPrice, double sellPrice)
      Matches buy and sell order prices to retrieve lowest price.
      Parameters:
      buyPrice - The price of the buy order.
      sellPrice - The price of the sell order.
      Returns:
      The lowest price (sell price), or -1 if buy price undercuts sell price.

    • getBuyOrders

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getBuyOrders() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Retrieves list of all the current buy orders in the database.
      Returns:
      A list of all the buy order IDs
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getSellOrders

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getSellOrders() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Retrieves list of all the current sell orders in the database.
      Returns:
      A list of all the sell order IDs
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • getOrders

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getOrders() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Retrieves list of all the current orders in the database.
      Returns:
      A list of all the order IDs
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • automateTransactions

      public static void automateTransactions() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Automates the "compareOrders" method to create transactions.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.

    • automateStatusUpdate

      public static void automateStatusUpdate() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Automates the "updateStatus" method to change status to "Unfulfilled" when the status is null.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - when something goes wrong with the database.
